intro: Cacalia otopteryx, commonly known as the silverleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue or white flowers. The plant has hairy, silver-gray leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Cacalia otopteryx is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
